Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2012 10:17AM tninalabama wrote: It's one of those everyone is different answers. Hopefully yours is slow growing this time. Worry gets to you, breathe and get your mind elsewhere for a while every day. I wish you luck.

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2012 02:32AM - edited Nov 29, 2012 02:33AM by tninalabama I lost my  hair in BIG clumps after the first round. I went ahead and shaved what was left because it was a lifeless mess. I also have lost my eyebrows and eyelashes again.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 01:08PM tninalabama wrote: Wishing you a Merry Christmas. I was in your shoes 3 years ago. I had a lumpectomy, then more was found from a breast MRI. I had a bilat mastectomy one month after the lumpectomy. Radiation will depend upon your oncologist and not the surgeon,s/he can only suggest. No nodal involvement may not mean any rads right now. Also treatment will depend on the pathology of your type. Keep positive thoughts.
Posts.Title: I have a possible diagnose dmho marie5890

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 06:59PM tninalabama wrote: You are normal. This is a big thing that grows a life of its own. People will continue to ask how you are for quite a while. I hope that you never have a recurrence, that really is the pits.  Good luck to you. It is very normal to worry, since we all want to see the children's milestones and enjoy a few grandchildren...

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 07:26PM tninalabama wrote: Lindy, While attitude has a lot to do with it, I believe that you've made it this far says a lot for your body's will to make. All the luck to you. I have a 12 year old and a 9 year old who need me. Plus I want to see them graduate! It's hard. PJ123 -- HOW DARE YOU!!! No one should get cancer!!!
Posts.Title: stage 4 and I'm 29 with a new baby lindyw82 justjudie

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 08:55PM tninalabama wrote: Sereena, I had axillary dissection in July. I had the remaining nodes removed and 12 /13 positive. I found a swollen node in November 09 and went through neoadjuvant to shrink any possibles. Didn't really help in my case. Anyway, my arm is still stiff. It bothers me in the evenings and when I try to get to sleep. During the day it's not too bad, just like a tight muscle from too much exercise. I have NOT had any lymphedma problems. My BS warned about problems with my first surgery, nothing then either.

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2012 12:58PM - edited Jan 23, 2012 01:02PM by tninalabama My eyelashes and eyebrows have not returned to their full glory yet. I originally completed cehemo April 08 and didn't start the next until January 10. I have gotten good at brow pencils and eye liner. Just a good line of liner helps. I have tried false lashes, but never quite got them right. They get into my line of vision,ugh!
